boardgame.name: The Iron Court
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vigil Watch Part Four details the roving city of the Iron Court, home to the Ironbred, and provides the first deep dive into Ironbred culture in the Scarred Lands!

boardgame.name: Superteam Strategies & Tactics
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A team should work together. The statement might seem absurdly obvious, but it is the single most important lesson a group of superheroes (or super villains, for that matter) can learn. Many so-called “teams” spend years trying to get a grasp on this elusive principle. Others don’t last that long and are broken by internal strife, humiliation, defeat, or some combination of the three. Those who do achieve a measure of appreciation for the idea, however, have another difficult task before them: that of actually putting it into practice. Once the members of a team understand that they have to be more than just a group of individuals on the same side, they must learn teamwork. They must maximize their individual strengths, and use them to compensate for the weaknesses of the entire team. They must become a whole more potent than the sum of its parts. In doing so, they can become unstoppable.

This sourcebook contains:

Team Roles: Airborne, Armor, Artillery, Infantry, Psi-ops, Special Forces, Specialist, Support And Transport
Team Composition,Team Themes Generator & Team Name Generator
Popular Teams: All Winners Squad/ Invaders, Alpha Flight (Classic), Authority, Avengers,Defenders (Original Team), The Doom Patrol (Classic), Doom Patrol (Vertigo Version), Excalibur (Classic), Fantastic Four, Freedom Fighters (Classic), Infinity Inc. (Original Team), Justice League Of America (Classic), Justice Society Of America (Modern), Kid Commandos, New Warriors (Classic), Outsiders (Classic), Teen Titans (New), Thunderbolts (Classic), X-factor (Modern), X-force (Classic), X-men (Classic), X-men (New Modern), X-men (Uncanny),
Maneuvers For A Team: Anchoring, Bombs Away, Dogpile, Hit The Nail On The Head, Interference,Speed Cushion, That’s A Wrap, Weird Science And 19 Additional Maneuvers.
Combat Partner Teams Sheet
Combat Partner & Team Specialized Combat Maneuvers Sheet
Team Code-words Sheet

boardgame.name: Project Biomodus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In our hubris, we became immortal. In our ignorance, we became monsters.”

Project Biomodus is the First TAPM20 System game, set in a desolate world created by mankind’s need to defeat death. Now – some eight centuries later – the world is a mass of scorched concrete husks, breeding grounds for adapted, powerful monsters and the transhuman descendants of humanity; all fighting for the right to exist in a world that is beyond healing.

boardgame.name: Project Biomodus: Get Rekt Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS A CONDENSED VERSION OF THE FULL RULEBOOK – SEE DETAILS FOR CONTENTS

“In our hubris, we became immortal. In our ignorance, we became monsters.”

Project Biomodus is the First TAPM20 System game, set in a desolate world created by mankind’s need to defeat death. Now – some eight centuries later – the world is a mass of scorched concrete husks, breeding grounds for adapted, powerful monsters and the transhuman descendants of humanity; all fighting for the right to exist in a world that is beyond healing.

GET REKT

The GET REKT version of this book is designed with simplicity in mind. While the book contains everything you need to play Project Biomodus, much of the lore, art, and backgrounds of the world are removed to make a simple reference guide to the game’s systems.

Whether you are on a tight budget, or perhaps want a copy of the rulebook to make notes in, guilt-free, the GET REKT version of PROJECT BIOMODUS is for you.

boardgame.name: Mooncake Master: Limited Edition Customer Cards
boardgame.description: Mooncake Master: Limited Edition Customer Cards is a set of three new customer cards for use with the Mooncake Master base game. It was included as a promotional item with some copies of Mooncake Master.

boardgame.name: Move it! A time keeping module for 5e
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Basically, this is just merging two popular pieces of content that are floating around, but it's got a bit of my own stuff in it. At its core, the module takes Angry GM's Time Pool and Animated Spellbook's video on event cards and codifies them into a time-keeping system that puts pressure on the players, while also giving inspiration a few more uses, and giving players some say over what dangers and rewards might exist in the world.

boardgame.name: Dragonsworn: A Fighter Subclass For 5E
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if a dragon sponsored a kobold? The answer is a plucky underdog who inspires allies and dominates the battlefield with gifts from a draconic patron.

boardgame.name: The Many-Formed One: A Warlock Subclass For 5E
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if a warlock's patron was actually a gargantuan mimic?

The warlock becomes a master of ambushing enemies; a menacing combatant who can be literally anywhere - literally anything - even the sword in your hand...

boardgame.name: Culture & Physiology: Pick-a-Path Race for D&D 5e
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meant to replace the race feature of a D&D 5e character, this module allows players nearly infinite possible ways to create balanced homebrew races.

More than that, though, it allows players and DMs to have conversations about the mechanics of their game world. For example, in a campaign world that is all human, players can decide what physical and cultural attributes make their human distinct from all the others. Weapons training? Magic training? A beefy build? Mechanics usually gated behind non-human races are suddenly available to players in a restricted campaign setting. Everyone in the party can be human and still mechanically distinct.

Likewise, in a setting with no limits on race, this splat book allows players to let their imaginations take control of character creation. Cactus-folk? Done. Half-tarrasque, half-ochre jelly? Done.

boardgame.name: Mouzling
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“There are many races on this plane that fancy themselves the most knowledgeable, or the most charming, or the most kind. How foolish they would feel if they knew that each of these titles belong solely to the humble mouzling.”
- Christus Lume, Rictiss of the Halls of Rollofinn

Mouzlings are tiny, wispy fey that stand around a foot tall and inhabit small earthen communities around the realms. Preferring to keep to themselves and avoid contact with most races, encountering these enchanted creatures may be rare, but it’s truly a gift to those with good hearts and intentions.

This supplement includes:

Lore and statistics on this fey creature.
A deep dive into their culture and society.
3 Statblocks for different mouzlings!
Plot hooks to get your party involved with these tiny creatures.

boardgame.name: Skremp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Never shall you find another creature less aware of its own annoying nature than a skremp. They talk too much, too often, and too loudly. Everywhere they go trouble follows them, or they create it where there’s none to be found. Worse yet, they seem to have an immensely good time while doing it all.”
- Razmer Highrandus, Majeer

Skremps are small goblinoids that stand on average between 3 and 3 and a half feet tall, with greyish-green skin, large ears, and slightly oversized hands and feet. Their impulsive natures, blunt speech, and overall crass demeanor is a taste acquired by few and has garnered them a reputation as everything from dangerous pests to resilient and humorous allies.

This supplement includes:

Lore and statistics on the Skremp.
Plot hooks to get your party of adventurers involved with this new creature.
Racial traits to turn this unruly creature into a Player Option!

boardgame.name: Crown Phoenix
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“The fire of the Crown Phoenix is a truly wondrous thing. In it is the ability to completely immolate, and to bring back the very thing it destroyed.”
- Cemythrian Odane, Last Wizard of the Lost Isle

Crown Phoenixes are extraordinary creatures originally from the Elemental Plane of Fire. Although rare, they can occasionally be found on the Prime Material, immersed in silvery-blue flames and gliding on thermals above steaming calderas.

This supplement includes:

Lore and statistics on the Crown Phoenix.

boardgame.name: Stonethrow to Winter's End
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 1st level introductory adventure for the Oldegrave RPG. "Stonethrow to Winter's End" covers a small area near the town of Magefall in the Eastern Marches of Havvengarde. Featuring a dungeon, wilderness encounters & new monsters for OG (including the horrific Tomb Worm!).

boardgame.name: A Blaze in the Northern Sky (Oldegrave)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 1st level introductory adventure for the Oldegrave RPG. "A Blaze in the Northern Sky" is a short mini-adventure dungeon crawl. Perfect for a night when you only have an hour or two to game.

boardgame.name: Legacy of the Lost Regiment (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Forgotten Treasury! Here we reveal some great new magical items, fit around a theme, that could well add some fun and diversity to your Pathfinder 1e experience!

This book tells, in part, the story of the Lost Regiment. An elite unit of rangers, barbarians, and scouts who served an ancient empire. They were known for their skill at arms, and served in several campaigns both at war and exploration. However, this would come to an end would they would attempt to trek and explore a mysterious region of the world dominated by an inpenetrable jungle.

This book presents several new items which help tell the story of how these Rangers came to be, and give a little background on their final expedition!

boardgame.name: The Witch Shack
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They told you the place was haunted, but you just had to go in anyway.

The Witch Shack is an encouter, an adventure location and a trap all in one!

Once you enter there's no easy way out. The hallways are a shifting maze and behind each door is a new random horror.

boardgame.name: The Under Caves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: The Under Caves is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: The Under Caves comprises 61 different tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations and is perfect for creating subterranean Underdark layouts.

boardgame.name: The Under Caves - Chambers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - Chambers is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - Chambers comprises eight 10x14 different tiles that depict large caverns and encounter spaces in the Underdark. Great as stand alone maps - even better with the modular set!

boardgame.name: The Under Caves - Great Cavern
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - Great Cavern is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - Great Cavern is a 20x30 battlemap depicting a large cavern in the Underdark. Two variants are provided - a large cavern, and one with a pit from an emerging burrower or monster. The maps work well on their own, but are even better with the Modular: Under Caves set.

boardgame.name: The Under Caves - River Chambers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - River Chambers is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - River Chambers comprises eight 10x14 different tiles that depict rivers in large caverns and encounter spaces in the Underdark. Great as stand alone maps - even better with the modular set!

boardgame.name: The Under Caves - Rivers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - Rivers is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - Rivers comprises 122 different tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations and is perfect for creating subterranean Underdark layouts. 61 tiles feature a narrow river, and 61 feature wide rivers. There are also tiles that allow the two river styles to join, and junctions with the Under Caves set.

boardgame.name: The Under Caves - The Lake
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - The Lake is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - The Lake is a 20x30 battlemap depicting a lake in a cavern in the Underdark. Two variants are provided - a large lake, and one with a perilous vortex whirlpool. The maps work well on their own, but are even better with the Modular: Under Caves set.

boardgame.name: The Hive Market Heist
The Hivemarket Heist
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

While returning from another mission for the Starfinder Society, the PCs receive a pre-recorded message from Venture-Captain Arvin, directing them to change course and head for Akiton. The Gonjar, a shobhad clan based near Ka, the Pillar of the Sky, has requested the Society’s aid.

The PCs meet with the Gonjar’s representative, Rolanok, in a bar outside Hivemarket, Akiton’s primary trading hub. Rolanok explains that Szelanius, a witchwyrd thief, has stolen several of his clan’s cultural artifacts and is currently hiding out in Hivemarket. The Gonjar attempted to apprehend her, but the khulan—Hivemarket’s impartial fey arbiters of order—kept justice from being served. The Gonjar are holding the perimeter, but they need the PCs to enter Hivemarket and retrieve the artifacts.

To do so, the Starfinders must perform some odd jobs for an ysoki mechanic, infiltrate and fight their way through an underground cold storage facility, and recover as many artifacts as possible before Szelanius can destroy the evidence. On their way out, the PCs must confront the thief in the Hivemarket square and somehow goad her into throwing the first punch, inciting the khulan’s wrath. Whether or not Szelanius escapes, the PCs must then engage her crew in a low-flying, in-atmosphere starship battle for the rest of the Gonjar relics!

boardgame.name: Rise of the Vault Lord
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs begin mid-mission, exploring a section of the mysterious false moon of Salvation’s End, when a group serving the mysterious Vault Lord appears and attacks! After the PCs defeat these adversaries, several drones enter the area and relay instructions from the guiding intelligence of Salvation’s End. The intelligence briefs the Starfinders on another vault under attack and through reason, intimidation, or appeal to their compassion for the test subjects, insists the Starfinders help it stop the Vault Lord.

The intelligence directs the PCs to a vault simulating Absalom Station during the Magefire Assault that occurred over 300 years ago. Arriving at the first access point, the PCs must contend with a large force of undead. Conditions become increasingly hostile. The Starfinders must rescue civilians in danger and overcome traps, hazards, and a shard of unliving magefire.

Eventually, the PCs reach the false Starstone Reactor chamber of the station, where the Vault Lord’s servants perform the steps necessary to seize the Absalom Station vault. A holographic representation of the Vault Lord appears and converses with the Starfinders. Realizing the PCs are working with the moon’s intelligence, the Vault Lord orders their minions to destroy the Starfinders and animates the surrounding debris and reactor components into an immense construct to annihilate the PCs and seize the vault!

boardgame.name: Waking the Worldseed
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Eons ago, two highly advanced civilizations—sivvs and kishalee—battled each other in seemingly endless conflict. As a last-ditch effort to end this cycle of destruction, the sivvs developed a superweapon called the Stellar Degenerator, which could vastly accelerate the rate of nuclear fusion in a star and drain away all of its energy, turning it into a cold, lightless, black dwarf star. However, in a daring gambit, the kishalee seized control of the superweapon before it could be launched and hid it away in a secret demiplane. The Sivv Dominion no longer had the means to keep pace with the war effort, and it was defeated. In just a few generations, sivv civilization ceased to exist.

Or did it?

boardgame.name: The Cawdor Complex
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Cawdor Complex is an adventure for Predation that is suitable for beginning or experienced players. Predation is a Cypher System setting. It will be useful to have a copy of both Predation and the Cypher System Rulebook handy when running this adventure.

While The Cawdor Complex can be played in any venue, it includes specific suggestions for running it as a stand-alone convention adventure.

For ease of play, this game includes six pregenerated characters and companions, so players can jump right in. In addition, you’ll find Group Affiliation notes for each character.

User summary:

See also Predation

boardgame.name: Leaving the Nest: A Predation Adventure
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Usable for both Predation and sci-fi Cypher games! You can run Leaving the Nest as a Predation adventure with teenage heroic PCs and their dinosoaur companions or as a sci-fi Cypher adventure with PC professionals!!

In a world filled with magafauna, your parents (or coworkers) never returned from the big city last night. They are missing in a world where they are at the bottom of the food chain.

A Cypher Predation mini-adventure, it's got an ability for Science Teen Heroes, sibling version of Relationships, the new state of Incapacitated, and new generic sci-fi ability, Adaptive Breathing. It's also got a time tracker chart if a GM wants a visual way to track the passage of time along with 4 Predation pregens and 4 sci-fi Cypher PCs.

boardgame.name: No Safe Place
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two little girls get sick after visiting a SATI resort on Eddis Island, and their reports of furry dinosaurs aren't believed by anyone. Desperate for answers, the family turns to your team to find out what happened on Eddis Island, and to make sure it doesn't happen again.

No Safe Place is an adventure for Predation, a Cypher System Setting. It requires the use of the Predation campaign setting from Monte Cook Games and the Cypher System Rulebook to run. Included are six pregenerated characters and companions.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: √âdition Martinique
boardgame.description:
A monopoly about a French island in the Caribbean Sea which capital is Fort-de-France.

Special features:

Numbered edition of 10,000 copies.
Includes rules for a short game.
Houses and hotels are made of wood.
Gilded metal tokens.


The capital of this island is Fort-de-France and of course this game also has some streets of this city. The properties are from Départ:

boardgame.description:
Escalation
The 13th Age Fanzine
Fall 2017

boardgame.name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North ‚Äì Yeti First Player Marker
boardgame.description: Wooden yeti first player marker, one of the preorder promos for Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North

boardgame.name: Samurai Skirmish Wargame Rules
Sengoku Jidai: Samurai fast play Skirmish Wargame Rules
boardgame.description:
These rules are designed to allow small skirmishes using Japanese warriors and peasants in the period from the rise of the Samurai till 1868 when the honorific was banned.

The system is meant to give a game where a reasonable facsimile of reality is seen, together with the possibility of characters appearing with the attributes of the legendary heroes of Japanese myth and legend.

Order of Play:
Play is Alternate between sides.
Each players turn consists of:

Move, Shoot, Load etc all figures in your force.
Any figures in Melee fight with the enemy figures in contact.
Check morale if needed.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Boshin War & Meiji Era Rebellions

boardgame.name: The Universal War
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I haven’t much time to recount any ridiculous histories before our time runs short, little Human. I will explain what I can. I will start at the beginning. After GOD died by his own hand Heaven was left empty and the OLD LAW was slowly abandoned by the Angels. The Demiurges, the only children of GOD, rebuilt the great works of Heaven. All 7,777,777,777 worlds were connected and for a time they were content to remain apart. They learned many secrets from the universe and lived in enlightenment and virtuous philosophy. It was not to last, of course. Their hunger grew. The Demiurges were warriors, not fat poets. They built weapons so great and powerful that reality itself was torn apart. With the order of the Angels gone, the Demiurges were free to do as they pleased and soon the Age of Prosperity led to the Age of Conquest. Wealth bred indulgence and want. Want… the curse of life itself. So began The Universal War. 7,777,777,777 universes burned. Worlds burned. And they went mad.

User summary:

The Universal War is prsented as a "choose your own adventure" style game. However, the system does not use numbered paragraphs but a series of choices to be made, most with multiple options. The primary emphasis on the game is the creation of a character that is rationalized by the backstory.

The game has a long development history with numerous incremental versions posted as PDFs in an online forum.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Binche ‚Äì Cit√© du Gille
boardgame.description:
To mark the fifteenth anniversary of Unesco, the City of Binche had the idea to publish a Monopoly to his colours. 1,500 copies of this version was made and was a great success.

We know Binchou's love for their City of the Gille so everything has been thought of in this special version to flatter the nice Chauvinism binchois. Players can buy emblematic places in their city, starting from the newly renovated Chapelle de Bettignies to the Hôtel de Ville, the most expensive acquisition.

Even the banknotes are in the colours of the folklore, taking again the characters of the carnival. Attention to detail, the famous chance cards and community box do not escape the binchoise sauce. Depending on the pickaxe, your fat Sunday costume will be offered, you will receive money to buy mimosa or a new Gille mask.


Pour marquer le quinzième anniversaire de l'Unesco, la Ville de Binche a eu l'idée de publier un Monopoly à ses couleurs.
1 500 exemplaires de cette version ont été réalisés et ont été un grand succès.

On connaît l'amour des Binchoux pour leur cité du gille, alors tout a été pensé dans cette version spéciale pour flatter le sympathique chauvinisme binchois.
Les joueurs peuvent acheter des lieux emblématiques de leur ville, de la Chapelle de Bettignies récemment rénovée à l'Hôtel de Ville, l'acquisition la plus chère.

Même les billets sont aux couleurs du folklore, reprenant les personnages du carnaval.
Souci du détail, les fameuses cartes chance et boite communautaire n'échappent pas à la sauce binchoise.
Selon la pioche, votre gros costume du dimanche vous sera offert, vous recevrez de l'argent pour acheter du mimosa ou un nouveau masque de gille.

boardgame.name: Space-Opoly
boardgame.description:
While we’re all spinning around in this fascinating galaxy, play to rule the universe! You could even own Mother Earth! And as you play, flip over the deeds and learn something about each cosmic element you own. Buy favorite celestial bodies and increase your rent by collecting Stars and trading them in for Orbs.

Sounds easy enough until your launch fails, or you hear a tiny hiss in your space suit, or worse yet- you’re sent to the Black Hole and you’re lost in space for three turns! Grab your token and Advance to the sun! Who knows! You may soon be the first human on Saturn…or you may be abducted by aliens!

Choose traditional play or 1-hour version.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company

listing.notes: Game is in very good condition and has been verified as complete including original instructions. All cards are in very good shape! Box has some dishing/creasing along one edge of the bottom of the box but overall the box is in good condition. Plastic storage tray/box insert is also present.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Knokke-Heist
boardgame.description:
Knokke-Heist, fashionable resort and undoubtedly the most versatile municipality on the Belgian coast. Sea and beach is supplemented by art, culture and a vibrant atmosphere.

Monopoly Knokke-Heist is the ideal way to (re)discover the municipality in a different way.
Visit the City Hall, go for a walk in the Zwin Nature Park, build a hotel on the Lippenslaan, play in the Casino or develop a real estate project on the Maes and Boereboomplein!

This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beautiful things that Knokke-Heist has to offer.

listing.notes:

boardgame.name: ÊàëÂÄëÈÉΩÊòØÊ®°ÁØÑÁîü We Are The Best!
boardgame.description:
Be polite to teachers in school!

In your turn you have to face up 1 card in front of you.


If you see some one: Be the first one say Hi to principal, director, or other teachers. If you are the last one say hi, you'll get minus points.



If you see activities in the class: Be the first one to act related actions.


If you are the first one act right action, you'll get card as victory point.

The player with most cards is the winner

boardgame.name: HITSTER
boardgame.description:
Listen to over 100 years of music hits and take turns guessing when the songs were released. You don´t need to know the exact year, only if they were released before or after other songs. Your chances of winning increases if you can also name the artists and song titles.

The first player to arrange 10 hits in chronological order wins the game and earns the title HITSTER.

Please note that to play HITSTER with the full game experience, you need to use a smartphone with the Spotify music streaming app.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Unknown 9: Awakening
Unknown9: Awakening
boardgame.description: Unknown 9 is an occult conspiracy thriller following a secret society, the Leap Year Society, as they search the world seeking 9 immortals

boardgame.name: Sam & Max: This Time It's Virtual
Sam and Max
boardgame.description: new VR game
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Gamescom Best Announcement of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Rise: A Tale of Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
Rise: A tale of kingdoms is a competitive board game. You step up as the new ruler of your kingdom. Everything seems quiet at the beginning. You want to be a good ruler and do your best for your kingdom.
But you are surrounded by neighbors, and each of them wants to be the most powerful king in the region. They attack you, try to rob you by unfair trades, and crush your kingdom down. You need to fight back or your kingdom will fall down ingloriously.
Develop your kingdom's resources or harm your opponents by playing a combination of certain cards. There are several advanced rules which can be mixed up together and play the game the way you like it.

boardgame.name: Crash Bandicoot 4: It's About Time
boardgame.description: sequel

boardgame.name: Cat and Ghostly Road
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Cat and Ghostly Road is an atmospheric point-and-click quest in which you play as a white cat.

Once the painter saved the cat, and they began to live together. But one day a misfortune happened to the man.

You need to help the man and save him from death. To do this, you have to go on a dangerous journey to the world of ghosts and demons.

Not all things are what they seems: in order to see their true form, you have a special vision.

boardgame.name: Captain Tsubasa: Rise of New Champions
boardgame.description:
The worlds of Soccer and Anime converge in Captain Tsubasa: Rise of New Champions, based on the renowned Captain Tsubasa series. The game chronicles the athletic exploits of Tsubasa Ozora as he plays out his love for the game and advances through the ranks of multiple Soccer leagues. Captain Tsubasa: Rise of New Champions immerses players in an action packed soccer game that features exhilarating gameplay, over the top signature shots and accessible gameplay.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Sports Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Necromunda: Underhive Wars
boardgame.description:
Deep below the nightmarish, polluted hive cities of Necromunda, in the twisted, vertiginous, dark tunnels of the Underhive, rival gangs fight to the bitter end for personal power, wealth, survival and the honour of their Houses. Only the strongest survive.

Lead, customize, and grow your gangs of Escher, Goliath, and Orlock. Specialize each member and send them to battle in hazardous dystopian environments. Exploit the terrain in tactical gunfights: climb raised walkways to take advantage, set traps, and ambush foes to force them into bloody melee engagements.

Learn new skills, loot equipment and bring your evolved gang to 4-player online gang fights.


Lead and evolve your gangs in this compelling tactical-RPG
Follow a rich narrative campaign in the Underhive
First video game adaptation from mythical tabletop game Necromunda, the most famous Hive World of Warhammer 40,000
Play solo or join thrilling 4-way online gang fights


Source: The Publisher's Website.

boardgame.name: Creepy Tale
boardgame.description:
User Summary

While walking with your brother, everything turns into horror and drags the hero into a series of terrible events. Your brother has been kidnapped, and you are left face-to-face with an ominous forest filled with dangers and strange creatures. Solve the puzzles that you meet on the way, do not let yourself be caught, and save your brother!
Find out the dark story that befell the once-calm and peaceful forest, turning it into a creepy place filled with evil. Perhaps it is you who will be able to solve all the secrets of the forest and save the peaceful creatures?

boardgame.name: Teardown
boardgame.description: eardown features a fully destructible and truly interactive environment where player freedom and emergent gameplay are the driving mechanics. Tear down walls with explosives or vehicles to create shortcuts no one thought was possible. Stack objects, build structures, or use floating objects to your advantage.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2020 Steam Awards Most Innovative Gameplay Nominee

Little Nightmares II
boardgame.description: sequel

boardgame.description: Sports

boardgame.name: Overide 2: Super Mech League
boardgame.description: Robot

boardgame.name: Lemnis Gate
boardgame.description: Lemnis Gate is the revolutionary turn-based combat strategy FPS taking place in a time loop.

boardgame.name: Struggling
boardgame.description: Struggling is a physics-based co-op platformer with a twisted spin on teamwork. Control the arms of a squishy abomination and guide it through a deranged world where anything goes. Outrun ravenous rats, joyride a dirt bike, and vault over pools of unmentionable waste. One thing’s certain: you will struggle.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Global Game Awards Best Comedy Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Medal of Honor: Above and Beyond
boardgame.description: Medal of Honor: Above and Beyond is an upcoming first-person shooter

boardgame.name: FOROG
boardgame.description:
Forog (which means to turn in Hungarian) is an abstract game for 2 players.

The game consists of a rubberwood board foldable in 2 and 19 wooden marbles, coloured in 6 different colours (3 marbles of each colour) + a natural wooden marble, and a wooden pot.

The aim of the game is to be the first player to place three of his balls in the opposing camp.

To begin with, each player chooses 3 colours of marbles and places them in 3 different holes on the board (which has 6 + a central hole).

In turn, each player takes all the marbles from one of the holes and deposits them one by one in the following holes.

As soon as a hole in his own camp contains 5 balls, he can select one of his balls and put it in the central hole. The other balls will be distributed normally. This is only possible if the natural wood marble is not in this hole. It is not mandatory.

Concerning this natural wood marble, the 1st player who puts a marble in the centre has the possibility to put the colourless marble in the hole he has just emptied. This marble then travels like the other balls during the game. The natural wooden ball is therefore a double-edged sword: it allows to block the opponent and forces him to redistribute his balls, but keeping it in his camp implies sacrificing one of his holes. Knowing when to keep the natural ball or when to send it to the opponent's side is therefore a determining factor in winning the game.

boardgame.name: Kyle is Famous
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Make decisions for Kyle that will affect every part of his day. Take Kyle's hand through 21 unique endings, each determined by what Kyle has done and who he has interacted with. He needs you. Be kind.

Kyle is Famous is a free to play Text Adventure.

boardgame.name: Let's Explore the Airport
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Let's Explore the Airport captures all of the fun, energy, and excitement of a real, working airport. Kids can check out the ticket counter in the main terminal, work the controls in the cockpit of the Concord, and see how the ground crew prepares the planes. Players can even sneak behind the scenes and find out where the baggage really goes. And that's just the beginning of this incredible tour.

Junior Field Trips turns kids loose to discover exciting new places up close and on their own. Children decide where they want to go and how much they want to know. Detailed explanations, lively sound effects and colorful animation make every trip truly one of a kind. Kids will want to come back to The Airport again and again. It's a place where curiosity and understanding reach new heights - and the fun never stops.

boardgame.name: Let's Explore the Farm
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Farm captures all the fun, energy and excitement of a real working farm. Kids can visit the big red barn and watch a cow being milked. Take a peek inside the chicken coop and find out where eggs come from. Help harvest the corn and feed the pigs. Don't miss the pond- there's a beaver dam to explore. And that's only the beginning.

Junior Field Trips turn kids loose to discover exciting new places up close and on their own. Children decide where they want to go and how much they want to know. Detailed explanations, lively sound effects and colorful animation make every trip truly one of a kind. Kids will want to visit The Farm again and again. It's a place where understanding and experience grow and fun never ends.

Let Buzzy the Knowledge Bug guide your child on a fun-filled trip to the farm!

boardgame.name: Let's Explore the Jungle
boardgame.description:
User Summary

No place on Earth is more mysterious or exciting than a jungle. Explore the dim interior of an Amazon cave. Dive into a river and take a swim with a hippo. View the inner workings of an underground ant nest. With Let's Explore the Jungle, children become involved and intrigued from the very first scene.

Spellbound and entranced, the only limitation to your child's involvement with Let's Explore the Jungle is their own endless curiosity and imagination. Travel through over 30 jungle places. Explore 215 detailed jungle descriptions. Interact with as endless array of click-points- see for yourself what happens when they click on the orchid-mantis, the flying fox, or the orangutan. Your child is in control.

Junior Field Trips turn kids loose to discover exciting new places up close and on their own. Children decide where they want to go and how much they want to know. Detailed explanations, lively sound effects and colorful animation make every trip truly one of a kind. Kids will want to visit The Jungle again and again. It's a place where curiosity and knowledge are the keys to fun and adventure.

Let your child begin a fascinating and educational journey to the jungles of the world.

boardgame.name: MudRunner - The Valley
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Get behind the wheel of 3 new vehicles and discover a huge new summer forest map designed to take full advantage of your heavy-weight trucks: The Valley.

Equip 8 new add-ons including new repair kits, trailers and fuel cannisters. Some of the new add-ons are compatible with vehicles from the base game.

boardgame.name: MudRunner - The Ridge
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Roll out with 2 new vehicles in a brand new map situated on the edge of a coast. A huge mountain ridge sits in the center and travelling between the two halves of the map will be a great challenge!

To complete these objectives players will have to scavenge the map searching for fallen logs at different locations.

boardgame.name: MudRunner - Old-timers
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Drive 2 new vintage General Motors trucks and explore the brand new Rocky Hills map designed to challenge your pick-up truck mastery.

boardgame.name: This War of Mine - The Little Ones
boardgame.description:
User Summary

This War of Mine: The Little Ones explores the hardships of wartime survival as seen from an entirely new perspective‚Äïthat of a child. This DLC puts you in charge of a group of adults and children stuck in a besieged city, struggling with basic necessities. TWoM: The Little Ones focuses not only on the reality of enduring war, but also on how even in times of conflict, kids are still kids: they laugh, cry, play, and see the world differently. In addition to thinking about survival, you'll have to summon your inner child to understand how to protect the little ones. Their youth, and their future, are in your hands.

boardgame.name: Legacy of the Lost Regiment (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Forgotten Treasury! Here we reveal some great new magical items, fit around a theme, that could well add some fun and diversity to your Pathfinder 1e experience!

This book tells, in part, the story of the Lost Regiment. An elite unit of rangers, barbarians, and scouts who served an ancient empire. They were known for their skill at arms, and served in several campaigns both at war and exploration. However, this would come to an end would they would attempt to trek and explore a mysterious region of the world dominated by an inpenetrable jungle.

This book presents several new items which help tell the story of how these Rangers came to be, and give a little background on their final expedition!

boardgame.name: The Ebon Soul (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darker than Midnight!

The legendary Crimson Shroud is a wondrous relic with miraculous healing powers, able to undo the deadliest of curses, but when the heroes go in quest of it they find they are not alone in its seeking. Dark agents work against them at every turn to find the prized artifact first, their shadowy fingers reaching through the very fabric of the city of Tourse. Who is a conspirator and who can be trusted are the questions the adventurers must answer as they race against time and a fate worse than death. In the end, their greatest test may be in facing the darkness awakened within their very souls.

The Ebon Soul is a 5th Edition adventure for 5th-level characters in the Lost Lands Campaign Setting. This rich and exciting world 20 years in the making has been home to dozens of adventures from Necromancer Games and Frog God Games and produced with their cooperation to be compatible with The World of the Lost Lands campaign guide! It is the second of six adventures in the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path, with each adventure exploring hitherto unexplored areas of the Lost Lands with a combination of horror, intrigue, deadly danger, and the lure of ancient mysteries.

While designed for use with the Lost Lands, these adventures are loosely connected rather than following a strictly controlled plotline, enabling you to easily place them into any campaign world. Your heroes can explore at their own pace to discover the secrets of antiquity or be consumed in their seeking as they brave the dark paths of the Aegis of Empires.

boardgame.name: The Ebon Soul (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darker than Midnight!

The legendary Crimson Shroud is a wondrous relic with miraculous healing powers, able to undo the deadliest of curses, but when the heroes go in quest of it they find they are not alone in its seeking. Dark agents work against them at every turn to find the prized artifact first, their shadowy fingers reaching through the very fabric of the city of Tourse. Who is a conspirator and who can be trusted are the questions the adventurers must answer as they race against time and a fate worse than death. In the end, their greatest test may be in facing the darkness awakened within their very souls.

The Ebon Soul is a Pathfinder Second Edition adventure for 5th-level characters in the Lost Lands Campaign Setting. This rich and exciting world 20 years in the making has been home to dozens of adventures from Necromancer Games and Frog God Games and produced with their cooperation to be compatible with The World of the Lost Lands campaign guide! While designed for use with the Lost Lands, these adventures are loosely connected rather than following a strictly controlled plotline, enabling you to easily place them into any campaign world. Your heroes can explore at their own pace to discover the secrets of antiquity or be consumed in their seeking as they brave the dark paths of the Aegis of Empires.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800 - Botanical
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Botanica DLC is part of the first season pass and primarily contains the Botanical Garden and associated items. It also provides the Music Pavilion and associated items.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800 - The Passage DLC
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Passage is the third Anno 1800 DLC that was released on December 10th, 2019. It is the third DLC of the Season Pass. It adds:

- A new polar region: The Arctic which contains snowy islands and massive glaciers, all stuck in a frozen winter wonderland.
- Two new population tiers. Explorers and Technicians.
- The need for Heating requires Arctic Settlements to be designed in a whole new way.
- A whole new way to transport cargo. Take to the skies with Airships.
- A Gas Power Plant with a bigger range and easier fuel transportation than Oil Power Plants.
- A new storyline to follow, which fleshes out the world and brings its own rewards.
- Neutral Inuit traders are present in the region.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800 - Seat of Power
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Seat of Power DLC is the first DLC of the Season 2 Pass, released on March 24, 2020. It adds a modular palace and local departments, which can affect and boost many of your buildings in European regions: Old World and Cape Trelawney.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800 - Bright Harvest
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Bright Harvest DLC is the second DLC of the Season 2 Pass, released on June 2, 2020. It adds Silos and Tractor Barns which increase the efficiency of animal and crop farms respectively. Silos consume specific resources to improve animal farms, while Tractor Barns boost crop farms but need a Fuel Station nearby to function properly. A Fuel Station turns Oil into fuel which powers up all nearby tractor barns. The DLC also adds the third upgrade to Oil Harbours and a set of agricultural and industrial ornaments.

boardgame.name: Assassin's Creed Odyssey - The Fate of Atlantis
Assassin's Creed: Odyssey ‚Äì The Fate of Atlantis
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Fate of Atlantis is a downloadable content expansion pack for Assassin's Creed: Odyssey, which was released on April 23, 2019. It is the second out of two expansion packs for the game, alongside Legacy of the First Blade.

A three-part episodic story arc, it is comprised of the memory sequences Fields of Elysium, Torment of Hades, and Judgment of Atlantis, with each episode being released roughly every six weeks from April 23, onward.

The expansion will set players against mythic creatures while they uncover the mysteries of the fabled sunken city of Atlantis.

boardgame.name: Assassin's Creed Odyssey - Legacy of the First Blade
Assassin's Creed: Odyssey ‚Äì Legacy of the First Blade
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Legacy of the First Blade is a downloadable content expansion pack for Assassin's Creed: Odyssey which was released on December 4, 2018. It is the first out of two expansion packs for the game, alongside The Fate of Atlantis.

A three-part episodic story arc, it is comprised of the memory sequences Hunted, Shadow Heritage, and Bloodline, with each episode being released roughly every six weeks from December 4, onward.

The expansion introduces players to the first person to ever use the Hidden Blade and will reveal more about the history that ultimately led to the formation of the Assassins.

boardgame.name: Assassin's Creed Origins - The Curse of the Pharaos
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Curse of the Pharaohs is a downloadable content expansion package for Assassin's Creed: Origins, was released on 13 March 2018. It is the second out of two expansion packs for the game, alongside The Hidden Ones.

Set four years after the conclusion of the main game, The Curse of the Pharaohs sees Bayek travel to Thebes and the Valley of the Kings, where he will uncover a mystery that will develop into a "living nightmare" for Bayek. Further exploring Egyptian mythology, the expansion pits Bayek against mythical beasts and dead pharaohs.

boardgame.name: Assassin's Creed Origins - The Hidden Ones
Assassin's Creed: Origins ‚Äì The Hidden Ones
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Hidden Ones is a downloadable content expansion package for Assassin's Creed: Origins, released on 23 January 2018. It is the first out of two expansion packs for the game, alongside The Curse of the Pharaohs.

Set in 38 BCE, after the events of the main game, The Hidden Ones sees Bayek travel to the Sinai Peninsula, where he will become entangled in a conflict between occupying Roman forces and a rebel faction. It also continues the story of the Hidden Ones, exploring the events that came after the formal founding of the Brotherhood.

boardgame.name: For Honor: Marching Fire
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The DLC included a new faction, the Wu Lin with 4 new heroes, Tiandi, Jiang Jun, Nuxia and Shaolin. It also included Breach, a new PvP mode as well as significant visual enhancements and the PvE Arcade Mode.

boardgame.name: Ranger of the Wild
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ranger of the Wild is a total Ranger rebuild with new subclasses and core class features meant to evoke the feeling of rangers in fiction.

The ranger of the wild allows you to play a character like Aragorn a man of the Night's Watch, or Geralt of Rivia.

Ranger spellcasting has been replaced with two new systems:

Quarry which allows the ranger to mark a target and focus all of their attention on that creature, dealing more damage and unlocking special abilities as they level up.

And herbalism, allowing the ranger to use their connection to nature to craft a variety of potions and oils that make them more effective in combat. Many of these concoctions require the ranger to defeat a creature and harvest part of it for the concotion, adding a new element to rangr gameplay.

Included in the PDF are 4 ranger conclaves:

Slayer Conclave: Hunt the biggest game from giants to dragons.
Shadow Conclave: Master guerilla warfare and hit and run tactics.
Plansewalker: Defend the material plane from extraplanar threats and banish your foes.
Spirit Warrior: Connect with nature and form a soul bond with an animal companion.

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 46 - Sep 2020)
boardgame.description:
Talbetop Gaming
September 2020

Magic: The Gathering - Our Guide to Getting Into Magic

boardgame.name: Dragon+ (Issue 33 - Aug 2020)
boardgame.description:
Dragon+
Issue 33

Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Kortrijk
boardgame.description:
Monopoly Kortrijk is the ideal way to (re)discover the Guldensporenstad in a different way.
Visit the Buda island, buy the Broeltorens, build a hotel on the Oude Leieboorden or go shopping in K in Courtrai !

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Dendermonde
boardgame.description:
Dendermonde, city of teeth and head meat fretters, is without a doubt the most beautiful city on the Dender.
Historic buildings in the city center, dating back to the Middle Ages, are complemented by modern architecture, art, culture and a vibrant atmosphere.

Monopoly Dendermonde is the ideal way to (re)discover Dendermonde in a different way.
Visit the City Hall, go for a walk in the city park, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, sell kopvlees or buy tickets for the Ros Beiaardommegang! This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Dendermonde has to offer.

boardgame.name: Connect 4 (Revised Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
Challenge a friend to checker-dropping fun with CONNECT 4! There are now five ways to play!

Original: Drop in your checkers and be the first to get 4-in-a-row to win.

Pop Out: Get 4 in a row by popping a checker out instead of dropping one in!

Pop 10: Pop checkers out of the grid. If your checker is part of a 4-in-a-row, you get to keep it. The first player to get 10 checkers wins.

Power Up: Use the power checkers to pop out one of your opponent's checkers. Use the "Play 2" checker to give yourself another turn.

5-in-a-row: For an added challenge use the sliders to the first player to get 5-in-a-row.

When you're done playing, tote your game around with a convenient carrying handle. The checkers store inside the grid so you're ready to play anytime!"

Contents:
42 checkers (21 yellow, 21 red)
Grid with checker catcher base/handle
2 Scoring Sliders
Instructions

boardgame.name: Lance Sullivan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This beautifully illustrated character playbook for the City of Mist RPG introduces Lance Sullivan, an old-school reporter and the Rift of Don Quixote.

Lance Sullivan has been a reporter since he lost everything in a freak flood that no-one seems to remember. With the help of his trusty photographer and friend Sanchez, he to be the renegade knight in shining armor the neighborhood so desperately needs. Lance is bent on telling the stories of the people who disappeared during that mysteriously forgotten catastrophe...

boardgame.name: Special Supplement 1: Alien Accommodations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Special Supplement series is an expansion of the basic Cepheus Engine rules that allow Referees to better represent the true differences of aliens. This is the first book in a series that will address how to accommodate aliens into the basic ship design process presented by the Cepheus Engine SRD and Cepheus Light. Special Supplement 1: Alien Accommodations deals with how to modify existing components to address aliens aboard. Stateroom size is the most obvious thing that might need to change but there are several other components that also need to be modified to deal with aliens. For the purposes of this book, and this series, we will not be specifying or assuming any particular type of alien; although being able to breathe the same approximate air mixture as humans is a common assumption.

boardgame.name: World of Myth and Wonder
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to World of Myth and Wonder, an add-on to Altering History. If you're looking to make Earth a bit more mystical, magical, or just plain weird, you're in the right place!

boardgame.name: Altering History CYOA
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Altering History, a CYOA where you are shunted back in time to do with human history, well... basically whatever you like. With a few "upgrades" to help you along the way, of course.

boardgame.name: Congratulations! You Died. And Now You Are In HELL.
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Congratulations! You died. And now you are in HELL.

But all is not lost, for you have a very special soul. The devil himself has come to you with an offer because of your potential. Instead of suffering for all eternity as one of the multitudes of pathetic human sinners you can become a Demon, to spend your eternity in relative comfort overseeing the prisoners. In order to gain this privilege you must agree to be sent back to earth (your death will be prevented and you will return at the same time you would have died) and cause as much misery and pain, whilst enjoying yourself as possible.
boardgame.rpg: Congratulations! You Died. And Now You Are In HELL.

boardgame.name: Handler/Fetish CYOA
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You meet a stranger whose face you can't see. She explains to you that she is the "Handler", a being with the ability to manipulate people's minds, interpersonal relationships and society. She is usually fair and doesn't abuse her powers too much, but lately she's been really bored and wants to have some fun.

boardgame.name: Tales of the Fabulist: Fantasy Deck
boardgame.description:
Tales of the Fabulist is an interactive fiction device, a party game, an improvisation system, a drinking game, an ice-breaker at retreats, and an excellent gift for the young and old. You don't have to be William Shakespeare to have a great time making sh*t up regaling your loved ones with a fabricated fable. Here's how easy it is:

After the decks are shuffled and cards are dealt, The Fabulist begins by introducing the characters in the context of a grand quest upon which the characters will embark. The Fabulist has sixty seconds to weave the beginning of the tale, then play rotates clockwise. The next player selects a plot twist (PT) out of their hand and places it on the included playmat in the next open PT space. That player continues the story for 30 seconds, working in the words or phrases on the newly played card into the story. When the time runs out, draw a new plot twist card. Play continues clockwise. The lucky person who places the final plot twist card has sixty seconds to wrap up the story as best they can.

Now that the fable has ended, everyone gets to suggest a "Moral of the Story". The player with the funniest moral wins the quest card. If your group is competitive, the person with the most quest cards at the end of the session wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Arena
boardgame.description:
Rivals Of The Void is a strategy card/board game focused on empire building, resource management and area control.

Rivals Of The Void is set an original Science Fiction universe with a sprawling space opera narrative.

Play as of one of four unique species as you attempt to control and colonize the known quadrant by means of Expansion, Diplomacy, Wealth, Reserves, Culture, Industry, Military, Technology, and Tradition.

Rivals Of The Void has many unique features such as a player created play board, with literally trillions of possible configurations no two games will ever be alike.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 1830: Railways & Robber Barons ‚Äì Seahorse organizer
boardgame.description: Custom designed and printed organizer for all the 1830 pieces.

boardgame.name: No Happy Endings (SWADE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once upon a time… the continent of Erato was a land of fairy tales, where princesses were saved, peasant heroes defeated cruel demons, and villains were doomed to fail. And they hated it. The cabal of fairy tale villains ended the age of fairy tales… and the Age of Reason began.

No Happy Endings is a mini-setting for Savage Worlds set in a world of fairy tales gone bad. Inspired by Central and Eastern European folk stories and the history of early Enlightenment Europe, it lets you explore strange but familiar lands. Inside you’ll find stats for talking cats, a handful of new Edges and Hindrances (like Dull, Foolish or Background Character), Arcane Backgrounds for fairy tale witches, alchemists and peasant heroes, and descriptions of five countries, full of adventure ideas.

And a fairy-tale bestiary, with tips on how to convert SWADE monsters for fairy tale stories, and with folk monsters, like nuckelavee, zmei, kharakternyk or drowner. All this in 32 pages.

This is a Savage Worlds version of the Adventurers! Setting and it updates the world with plenty of new information.

boardgame.name: 1846: The Race for the Midwest ‚Äì Seahorse Organizer
boardgame.description: Organizer for all tiles, shares and tokens in the game.

boardgame.name: Holiday Hijinks #1: The Kringle Caper
The Kringle Caper
boardgame.description:
Shenanigans are afoot at the North Pole, and it's up to you to figure out what happened!

The Kringle Caper, title #1 in the Holiday Hijinks line, is an escape room style game in just 18 cards! As a group, you will solve a series of puzzles to unravel a mystery.

When you have solved a puzzle, you will enter the answer into the companion web app (compatible with all smart phones and computers) and it will check whether you are correct. If you are, the app will tell you which card or cards to take next.

The app also contains a graduated hint system, so if you get stuck you can get just a small hint about the current puzzle to get moving again without giving too much away.

Puzzles may test your perception, wordplay, and lateral thinking. English language fluency is required. Knowledge of traditional Christmas topics is helpful, but that information is also provided in the app if you need it.

Most groups take about an hour to solve the game. You can write on the cards to help solve puzzles, but this is not required (or you could use penny sleeves) and the game is otherwise non-destructable. So while you can't play again yourself, you could give the used game to someone else to play.

boardgame.name: The Kobold Wizard's Dildo of Enlightenment +2
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Module B69
For Advanced RPG Game
An Adventure for 3-6 Players, Levels 2-5

From the introduction:

User summary:

This adult "fan fic" story is presented as an adventure, though the fiction is interleaved with game data for various spells, monsters, and other items. Numerous pre-generated characters (or, non-player characters) are also fully detailed.

boardgame.name: Aftermath
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Enemy Revealed at Last!

The search for the Technocracy's hidden stronghold leads the team to an uncharted region rumored to be the resting place of an legendary item of immense power. On a planet ravaged by war, can the heroes find a way to secure the ancient device?

Aftermath is a 4 hour adventure for 5th through 8th level characters using the Esper Genesis Roleplaying Game. It is also part of the Crucible Corps organized play campaign.

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Bestiary 2 Pawn Collection
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

An army of monsters has arrived, and they're ready to invade your game! The Pathfinder Bestiary 2 Pawn Collection is the best way to present these monsters on your gaming table. This collection of creatures represents those found in Pathfinder Bestiary 2 and are perfect for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any fantasy RPG.

This collection presents beautiful full-color images of a wide array of deadly denizens, including more than 300 monsters such as dragons, giants, the Jabberwock, new elementals, deadly aquatic foes, vampiric menaces, creatures from other realities, demons, devils, angels, and much, much more! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder Pawns Base Assortment, making them easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. The Pathfinder Bestiary 2 Pawn Collection is the best way to ensure you've got the perfect monster for every Pathfinder Roleplaying Game encounter!

boardgame.name: Choose Your Guild CYOA
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

After weeks spent trudging through the wilderness, you come across a magnificent, walled city. It stretches out before your eyes like an ocean.

You are a Nobody, neither Highborn, nor Pauper.

The only way to survive in this city is to... Choose Your Guild

User summary:

Each page of the PDF has a different (but very large) page size.

boardgame.name: Monmouth: Brandywine 3.0 Map only Expansion
boardgame.description:
Monmouth is desperate rearguard action from the American Revolution at the end of the Philladelphia Campaign.

Brandywine Expansion

You must have our Brandywine 3.0 game to play this!

You can also play this with our Standard Blocks.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Scrub's Center for American Medicine
boardgame.description:
Everyone is Valued at SCAM! Players are business directors of specialized Wards in a hospital. Players compete to have the most profitable ward. In doing so, players will attempt to admit the most valuable patients to their ward, manage their Public Relations, and "get rid" of poorer patients from their wards by transferring them to other wards or simply letting the poorer patients "expire."

Players will first draft a hand of procedure cards that will allow them to cleverly manage patients in wards and in the waiting room. Players will then play these procedure cards to triage patients to their advantage and commit medical malpractice in the name of the almighty dollar. At the end of each round, players will bill the patients currently admitted in their wards and claim any PR bonuses.

The game revolves around a line management mechanic: Players will always admit the first patient in line in the waiting room, so carefully playing procedure cards to put valuable patients to the front of the line on your turn is key! Each player will also organize patients in their wards in five different rooms. Each room increases in the amount that you can charge a patient, so try to put more valuable patients to the right. However, if they go too far and must be shifted right, the patient will die. This lowers your Public Relations score, which lowers your chance at a bonus for the end of the round.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Vessel Runners
boardgame.description: In Vessel Runners, you are tasked with building an automated delivery ship. Each round, you’ll gain the favor of various crew members to help you outfit your ship. Survive meteor showers and ward off pirates to ensure a safe delivery of goods! Players score points by delivering cargo. The player with the most points at the end of 14 rounds is the winner!

boardgame.name: Murakumo: Renegade Mech Pursuit
boardgame.description: In the year 2090, a new energy source is invented and a city is constructed to focus on the further development of this energy called Oliver Port. In response, a company called LugnalCorp utilizes this energy source for the development of conscious mecha known as ARKS (Artificial Reflexive Keneticoid). Due to the high industrial demand for the ARKs, LugnalCorp rushes the ARKs into production; after a while of operation, the ARKs rebel against their human operators and start their rebellion over Oliver Port. A team of fighter pilots is assembled to combat the renegade ARKs under the name of Murakumo.

boardgame.name: Dream of Genie
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You find yourself in the midst of a strange land. You see Byzantine architecture bizarrely sutured together with massive Egyptian monuments. A howling expanse of endless desert paradoxically ends, transitioning immediately into a lush garden of stone walkways and fountains and blooming fruit trees. Above, the sky is bright blue and filled with fluffy clouds, but the sun itself is nowhere to be seen. There is no question that this is a dream. Nothing could be more sure in your mind. Yet it feels more real than anything you have experienced in your entire life. And you don't even remember falling asleep.

User summary:

This "choose your own adventure" style solitaire scenario is published as a series of four (large) JPG images.

boardgame.name: Djinn Localization Center
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You do not wake up. Sure, you regain consciousness, there's no disputing that. But "waking up" is not an accurate term for whatever just happened to you. The last thing you remember is advice to watch your head.

User summary:

This resource is published as two (very large) JPG files.

boardgame.name: Art Connoisseur Genie CYOA Catalog
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I see you admire my many galleries. Glad to hear that the people today still appreciate art. Here's a list of each of my art galleries. There's a few ways to pick your wishes, so I'll outline them here.

boardgame.name: Dream of Genie Optional Text Companion
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This resource presents a variety of options and hints, as well as commentary, on playing the game.

boardgame.name: Raiders of the North Sea: Collector's Box
boardgame.description: Raiders of the North Sea: Collector's Box contains a plastic insert that can store Raiders of the North Sea, Fields of Fame, and Hall of Heroes as well as 200 themed card sleeves.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Raiders of the North Sea: Fields of Fame
Raiders of the North Sea: Hall of Heroes

boardgame.name: Tanks: Mechanics Kit
boardgame.description:
Before a tank is ready to go to war it must be assembled by a team of skilled mechanics, using only the best tools. Having a mechanic on your crew is even more useful! They know their tanks inside and out and can get them back up and running after almost any hit.

The Mechanics Kit includes an exclusive TANKS crew card. The Skilled Mechanic crew card will only be available in this Kit.

This pack contains:
1x Plastic Glue
1x Clippers
1x File
1x Skilled Mechanic Crew Card - Text says: This tank passes Repair Damage rolls on a result of 3, 4, 5, or 6.

boardgame.name: Hidden Strike: American Revolution
boardgame.description:
Hidden Strike: American Revolution recreates the struggle between the American colonists and the British forces during the War of Independence. Each side tries to win the war by controlling a majority of regions.

Confronted by overwhelming forces, the colonists will need strategy to defeat the larger British army and navy to gain their Independence. This is a card driven game, where players manage their hand of cards, usually playing just one card a turn to allow them to move tokens representing military forces across the board into key spaces at key times.

The game can be played in five different modes:

Solitaire: For those brave enough to take on the British forces on their own this mode offers a regular and a hardcore option. This mode is a good starting point if you’re trying to learn the game by yourself.
Versus: A fierce head-to-head in which one player pitches the British forces against the other player’s American troops.
Co-op mode: In this cooperative mode all players share the same objective: take on the role of the American colonists to win Independence from the British.
Traitor Mode: The inclusion of a secret traitor who will try to thwart the Americans’ efforts adds a devious twist to the co-op mode.
Mastermind: As one player assumes the role of George III the Sons of Liberty will have to band together to overcome the British King’s formidable forces.

boardgame.name: Brigada 1936: La Guerra Civil Espa√±ola
boardgame.description:
Brigada 1936: La Guerra Civil Española is a wargame. It is designed to combine several of the most relevant factors in the conflict: politics, economics, strategy and military tactics. It is a dynamic and informative game, in which players will have to make strategic decisions based on multiple conditions.

Each game lasts between 2 and 4 hours. The duration can be set before starting the game by changing some values ‚Äã‚Äãof the rules. The longer the game is configured, the more balanced it will be between both sides.

It is played on two sides. Each player represents a military leader. 4 player games are recommended. In other combinations the duration of the game can be increased.

The rules are straightforward, designed to be quick to understand and entertaining.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tarot: A Game of Souls
boardgame.description:
Tarot: a Game of Souls is a competitive, trick taking game. Winning a hand is called “Taking a Trick”. Each player takes turns in the role of Soul Hunter for a round between five and seven hands long.

There are five different hands that can be played in each round in the Basic game. Each hand has a different objective, and each hand is played only once in a round. Each hand’s objective has a soul value and players win or lose souls from their opponents depending on how well they play the hand. During the round, the Soul Hunter attempts to win souls from the other players.

Once played, the token next to that hand is removed from the Soul Hunters board and only those hands with tokens remaining may be played. Each of these hands will be played once to complete a full round.

The winner is the player who has collected the most souls at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 18Chesapeake: Seahorse Organizer
boardgame.description: A custom 3D printed organizer to hold all the pieces for the game ready to play

boardgame.name: 18MEX: Seahorse Organizer
boardgame.description: Custom 3D printed organizer to hold all the game pieces ready to play. This organizer is for All Aboard Games edition of the game.

boardgame.name: Traveller's Tale
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Homeworld of Ae kid, this is where we all come back to at the end of the day, here we are eternal. But eternity is boring, right? Now, I have a few forms for you to sign, just a formality if your grabber already applied the tests to make sure your mind won't explode, you'll survive upgrading and that you're not a totally nonredeemable shit, we have to keep administration sated.

boardgame.name: Picnic
boardgame.description:
Nobody likes to find chaos when going to prepare their Picnic, but this time it has happened. You find all your meals and tablecloths mixed... It's time to reorder them!

Picnic is a game for 1 to 5 players where we will try to organize our picnic in the best possible way. Through a SmartDraft system (Implemented in the previous game 'Juices'), players will select their cards to put them in their playing area in such a way that they combine the largest possible number of elements, food and tablecloths.

Picnic has several game modes and modules to add complexity and replayability: Objectives, placement systems, restrictions, ... Adapt your games as you wish!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Storied Game of Alice
boardgame.description:
The Storied Game of Alice, or, Anon's Amazing Semi-Randomized Animu Style Waifu Generator for Lonely Neckbeards

From the introduction:

The following document contains advice and random generation charts to allow you to create a "love interest" type character somewhat inspired (in some cases, at least) by the conventions of romantic anime, named Alice Schmidt. You may simply bask in the pleasant sensation of imagining such a girl as your own lover, or practice your writing skills by composing a short scene or a few starring it or it and yourself. The following paragraphs are merely introduction. If you've already played the game of Alice or don't wish to be bothered, feel free to skip right ahead to "Generating Alice".

boardgame.name: Necromancer CYOA Part 1 of 2
boardgame.description:
Form the introduction:

You are the student of a powerful necromancer. Trained since a very young age himself, he has accumulated a great wealth of knowledge, and a repository of grimoires, tomes, and other treasures over his lifetime. For the last two decades, he has been training you in the multitude of necromantic schools he has mastered.

So far your training has been kept generalised, free from a singular field in which you excel to the detriment of others, meaning for the moment you are a jack-of-all-trades; at least until you venture out on your own as a journeyman. Only then will you choose one field above all others to which you will devote your time, effort, and resources.

He is old now, and reluctant is he to enhance himself or force an unnatural conclusion, and thus he relies greatly upon your youthfulness as well as the creations he has crafted and the servants he has raised over his lifetime.

boardgame.name: Necromancer CYOA Part 2 of 2
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Necromancer CYOA Part 2 of 2 presents numerous play options for the scenario, including minions, perks, enemies, drawbacks, and lairs. Additionally, the world (setting) is described.

boardgame.name: Dino World
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore an abandoned dinosaur theme park in search of your quarry…but beware! Predators of all sorts stalk the crumbling ruins and toppled tourist attractions of Dino World.

Dino World is an DDAL - Oracle of War salvage mission for Tier 2 characters that can be completed in 3-4 hours. It is Adventurers League legal if used in conjunction with Oracle of War: Salvage Bases and Missions.

Dino World was designed with the Eberron setting in mind, but it can be easily adapted to most fantasy settings, and makes a great one-shot game or sidequest. As an added scaly bonus, it uses every single dinosaur stat block published for 5e!

boardgame.name: MSX
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[MSX is] a simple and easy to learn RPG. Its minimalist rules, with a distinct OSR vibe, encourage participants to use their creativity to overcome challenges. To play MSX you will need some six-sided dice (D6), paper and a pencil.

boardgame.name: Jreg's Centricide Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“Wow. That was excellent. Modern day political satire is in a truly good place.” - Jreg

The Centricide YouTube series depicts a world in which all the various political ideologies which exist today are personified and live amongst one another in what can be best described as a constant state of conflict.

boardgame.name: Mountain Bike Downhill
boardgame.description:
Mountain Bike Downhill is a mountain bike racing micro-game that uses only 9 cards and a handful of dice and tokens.

Bikers have to manage their exhaustion levels as they pedal downhill, all while watching what their opponents are doing. This all happens through a simultaneous bidding mechanic that sees players spending their biker's Exhaustion levels in order to get the best Speed Dice and go faster.

To recover from accumulated Exhaustion levels, players can Rest. Clever timing of the Rest action is key to victory as bikers can coast downhill without pedaling, but lose your energy in an uphill stretch and you'll be in trouble! Like in a real bike rally, it's not simply sheer effort that wins the race, but most intelligent use of energy!

Mountain Bike Downhill was first designed as an entry to the 2020 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest.

boardgame.name: Space Station IN-248: Five Parsecs Scenario 3
boardgame.description:
This scenario pack for Five Parsecs From Home can be worked into any ongoing campaign and sends you into a derelict research station to download computer files.

Space Station IN-248 offers a replayable scenario, fighting off alien hordes while trying to achieve your objectives. You may even get a new prototype weapon out of the deal.

This pack is intended for use with the current iteration of Five Parsecs From Home. To ensure the most compatible result, make sure you've downloaded the most recent update to the rules.

There is no need to restart your campaign to use this pack.

—description from the publisher
